title: Colin Firth and Lucia Moniz reprise their loved-up characters in new Love Actually 2 sneak peek
text:
Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
It's one of the most highly-anticipated sequels of the year - despite being just 10 minutes long. 
And fans of Love Actually were given yet another tantalising sneak peek of what awaits them on Red Nose Day, as a picture of Colin Firth and Lucia Moniz in character appeared online. 
Reprising their roles as bumbling British writer Jamie and his Portuguese sweet-heart Aurelia, the two stars are pictured sat in a car looking slightly exhausted. Read More When is Comic Relief 2017 on TV? Love Actually fans were given a surprise on Friday when a picture of Colin Firth and Lucia Moniz in character appeared online (Photo: emmafreud/Twitter) 
Having originally found romance when Jamie played taxi for the cleaner and waitress in the 2003 film, it looks as though not much has changed for the love-birds. 
Pictured with a baggy jumper on, the only thing that has changed about Colin's character appears to be his shorter hair, while Aurelia is instantly recognisable despite having a trendier haircut. 
The teaser was released by Emma Freud on her Twitter account along with the caption: "1 week till rednosedayactually on BBC1. Has he aged? Could he be more handsome? Is she perfect?" The snap show Colin and the actress back in character as Jamie and Aurelie for the Red Nose Day special (Photo: WireImage) 
Anticipation around the sequel to the 2003 roof has been hitting fever pitch, but following the announcement of the sequel (being filmed for charity) writer and director Richard Curtis confessed he was "always sure" he would never do a Love Actually sequel . 
The film's director admitted he didn't ever plan to produce a follow-up movie, telling the Radio Times: 
"I've always been sure I wouldn't do a sequel – but I had sometimes thought it would have been fun to see what some of the characters were up to. 
"Fifteen years later you can be pretty sure that Bill Nighy's Billy Mack would still be releasing dodgy records." Read More Richard Curtis recently revealed he never wanted to make a Love Actually sequel (Photo: Twitter/@emmafreud) But he wanted to see where everyone ended up (Photo: Copyright: 2003 Universal Studios. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.) What's happened to Kiera Knightley's character? (Photo: Rex Features) 
However, Richard soon changed his mind in the name of charity and has created a 10-minute short movie Red Nose Day Actually, which is being filmed for Comic Relief .He said: "I thought about the night of Comic Relief. 
"Over the years I've done specials of Mr Bean and Blackadder and The Vicar of Dibley and I suddenly thought I could do a little special of Love Actually set on Red Nose Day. Read More And what about Andrew Lincoln's character? (Photo: Universal Studios) He's looking much older now! (Photo: BBC) 
"And it seemed like a good moment to make it, too – every year Red Nose Day strikes me as a demonstration of the basic generosity of the British public. 
"And I did want one or two of the couples to have a kid of two – and see what happened to Liam Neeson's son once he was all grown up." Read More
